page.title: 06Places of Worship, Oldland
page.content: There are strong non conformist roots in this area. John Wesley and fellow Methodists are reputed to have preached many times on Bridgeyate Common. Two chapels lie in the 4 sq.km of our block:{Bridgeyate Methodist {Church, known as 'The Chapel on the {Common',}was built in 1810. Tiny cottages then encircled the Common. Recent renovation has brought the church into a good state of repair. It has a weekly service on Sunday morning with an average congregation of 50; also Sunday School with 30 children. {Oldland Gospel Hall}is a small, non-denominational mission hall founded 60 years ago. The average congregation is 20 - mainly older people. There is no provision for children. It is run by local elderly couple with narrow views.
